ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Have you ever felt that you ought to cut down on your drinking or drug use?
Have people annoyed you by criticizing your drinking or drug use?
Do you ever feel bad or guilty about your drug use? If never use drugs, choose "No"
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 998 = Not collected at this time point; 9999 = no data

ElementDescription: Have you ever had a drink or used drugs first thing in the morning to steady your nerves or to get rid of a hangover?

Notes: 0=no tendency to drug use; 1+=a possible substance use disorder and a need for further testing

ElementDescription: Do you ever feel bad or guilty about your drinking?
How many drinks does it take to make you feel high?
Notes: 0= Less than or equal to 2 drinks; 1 =More than 2 drinks

ElementDescription: T-ACE Score (Tolerance, Annoyance, Cut Down, Eye-Opener)
Notes: Sum of cage 01, cage02, cage04, cage05
